text: , is a town located in Hidaka Subprefecture, Hokkaido, Japan. As of April 2017, the town has an estimated population of 4,482, with 2,242 households, and a density of 12 persons per km2. The total area is 364.33 km2. The local economy is dominated by agriculture, including breeding horses for racing, tourism and the harvesting of wild konbu. Samani is at the end of the Hidaka Main Line that runs from Tomakomai. However, no services have operated between station and station since January 2015, due to storm damage. Plans to repair the suspended section of the line have been abandoned, due to high repair costs and low ridership, and the segment will be formally closed on 1 April 2021. A bus service will replace this section. The Oya-ko rock formation off the coast of Samani One of the best known sites in Samani is the that sit just offshore. They are known by this name, meaning Parents-and-Child, because they are a formation of two larger rocks and smaller one.
